description.narrative: The development objectives of the proposed project are to reduce land degradation in agricultural landscapes and improve the agricultural productivity of smallholder farmers.

condition.narrative: A qualified project accountant to be hired in each region to support project financial activities
Financial management training programs to be provided by the Project Finance Division at MoARD to all staff involved in finacialmanagement under terms of reference acceptable to the Association

comment.narrative: Amhara Teff: 13.76 (13.18)Amhara Maize: 21.84 (20.53)Amhara Cow milk: 194.2 (197.9)Oromia Teff: 10.10 (14.59)Oromia Maize: 27.60(24.81)Oromia Cow milk: 253.7 (203.9)Tigray Teff: 7.97 (10.12)Tigray Sorghum: 16.40 (15.11)Tigray Cow milk: 329.2(323.2)Benishangul-Gumuz Sorghum: 15.65 (22.78)Benishangul-Gumuz Finger millet: 7.99 (13.13)Benishangul-Gumuz: 220.7 (190.3)GambelaMaize: 24.07 (15.59)Gambela Sorghum: 20.94 (19.29)Gambela Cow milk: 457.9 (448.0)SNNPR Maize: 17.30 (16.13)SNNPR Wheat: 18.93(21,09)SNNPR Cow milk: 190.6 (219.0)Values in parenthesis are for the non-intervention areas.
No EoP value was set. Attribution may be difficult because of the number of variables unless the indicator is revised.
Data for this indicator is currently being collected by the CSA and should be ready by May 15, 2013

title.narrative: Percentage increase in agricultural productivity (for dominant crops and livestock)

title.narrative: Sub-projects (proposed) subjected to screening with the Environmental and Social Management Framework before approval

comment.narrative: Baseline data being collected
Field visits indicate that no adverse safeguard risks have emerged from implementation of project activities. Sub-projects areusually screened.

title.narrative: Percentage increase in area under sustainable land management practices in the targeted watersheds

comment.narrative: Cumulative value for 2011 is 127,859.
Expected EOP value is 210,000
As at February 2013, about 83% of the target value had been achieved.

title.narrative: Percentage increase in area under sustainable land management practices in the targeted watersheds

comment.narrative: Cumulative value for 2011 is 127,869.
Expected EOP value is 208,000
According to the results agreement, data was expected to be available by end PY02. Baseline data is still being collected foranalysis.
Increases (%) over baselineSep-2010: 3.5%, Sep-2011: 7.0%
Initially no EoP value was set. Attribution may be difficult because of the number of variables unless indicator is revised.
The September 2012 data is about 23.3% higher over the baseline. Feb 2013 NDVI data is expected now.

title.narrative: Issuance of land certificates, with geo-referencing and maps, to smallholder farmer households

comment.narrative: Only 1st level certification was practiced in the country prior to 2011
22,229 certificates issued. 229.642 land parcels surveyed.

title.narrative: Project M&E reports (quarterly) delivered on time

comment.narrative: Progress reports are delivered on time and in acceptable quality to the Bank.

title.narrative: Beneficiary farmers with a sense of tenure security compared with non-beneficiaries (KPI)

comment.narrative: The ongoing impact evaluation study carried out by the Central Statistical Agency will provide information on the perception offarmers to tenure security.

title.narrative: Timely actions on implementation problems, incl. procurement and FM taken increased
Implementation progress based on annual work plan achieved
Development Agents & Woreda experts using information on best management practices in sustainable land management from MoARD's KMS (KPI)

comment.narrative: According to the results framework, data is expected in PY03. Baseline data not available and hence determination of performancelevel difficult.

title.narrative: Percentage of Development Agents (DAs) and Woreda experts using information on best management practices in sustainable land management from MoARD's knowledge management system.

comment.narrative: A study published in April 2012 indicated that 45% of 60 development agents and 60% of 40 Woreda experts interviewed in Amhara ,Oromia and Tigray were aware of MoA’s knowledge management system.

title.narrative: Percentage increase in the number of beneficiary farmers with a sense of tenure security compared with non-beneficiaries

comment.narrative: Data is currently being collected under the impact assessment study being carried out by CSA. Data is expected by May 15, 2013.

title.narrative: Percentage of proposed sub-projects subjected to screening with the Environmental and Social Management Framework before approval

comment.narrative: Target values expected to be 100%

title.narrative: Agricultural productivity (for dominant crops and livestock) increased

comment.narrative: Measurements should be done separately for selected crops and selected livestock

According to the result framework, target values are expected in PY03. This indicator will be revised as part of the proposedrestructuring and the indicator will be split into 2, separately covering crop and livestock productivity increases.
